content.description: This is a fun climb with fairly solid gear. The route can be jammed or laybacked and can be sharp in places. This has a reachy start and has slick feet outside of the crack. At the bulge near the top, traverse left to join with Lefty Loosey. Shares an anchor with Lefty Loosey.
content.location: This route is just right of Lefty Loosey and to the left of Fun in The Sun

content.description: This is a rough and sometimes painful crack that is hard to protect with gear. There is a two bolt anchor that can be accessed from the top of the cliff. The start of the crack is the crux. The crux consists of slick feet with a reachy jug. The crack the widens to a fist jam. Watch out for the loose block at the very top above the bulge. Shares an anchor with Righty Tighty
content.location: This is just right of Righty Tighty.

content.description: Starts with a short lieback to a large rail with poor feet. Get on top of the rail to the crux of the climb. The crux is technical climbing on small crimps and footholds. This route shares an end with Buns in The Sun.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: This route is right of Right Tighty and just left of Buns in The Sun.

content.description: Follows dual cracks to the top of the cliff and shares an anchor with Fun in The Sun. Takes okay gear with very solid feet.
content.location: On the East side of the wall and just left of Fun in The Sun.

content.description: Diverse granite climbing ranging from easy slabs to hard overhanging sport climbs. This cliff contains trad and sport climbing with TR access. Great for all seasons.
